intro: Oenanthe interrupta, commonly known as the common water dropwort, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, such as stream banks and damp meadows. Its root system is fibrous and can be somewhat toxic, containing compounds that may cause gastrointestinal irritation. Oenanthe interrupta is often found in temperate regions of Europe, Asia, and North America.
